Modelling Spinodal Decomposition

3 module potentials
4 
5  use iso_fortran_env
6  use grid
7 
8  implicit none
9 
10 contains
11 
16  subroutine bulk_potential(mu, c, a)
17 
18  real(real64) :: mu(:, :)
19  real(real64), intent(in) :: c(:, :)
20  real(real64), intent(in) :: a(:)
21  real(real64) :: val
22  integer :: nx, ny, n, i, j, k
23 
24  !Get mu grid size and number of user input coefficients
25  nx = size(mu, 1)
26  ny = size(mu, 2)
27  n = size(a)
28 
29  !Initialize mu array with zero values
30  mu = 0.0
31 
32  ! Loop filling the mu array
33  !$omp parallel do default(shared) private(j,i,k)
34  do j = 1, ny
35  do i = 1, nx
36  val = 1.0_real64
37  do k = 1, n - 1
38  mu(i, j) = mu(i, j) + k * a(k + 1) * val!c(i, j)**(k - 1)
39  val = val *c(i,j)
40  end do
41  end do
42  end do
43  !$omp end parallel do
44 
45  end subroutine bulk_potential
46 
55  subroutine total_potential(Q, mu, c, dx, dy, Kappa,conc_halo)
56 
57  real(real64), intent(in) :: mu(:,:)
58  real(real64), intent(in) :: c(:,:)
59  real(real64), intent(in) :: dx, dy, Kappa
60  real(real64), intent(in) :: conc_halo(:,:)
61  real(real64) :: Q(:,:)
62  real(real64) :: lap_x, lap_y,dx2,dy2
63  integer :: nx, ny, i, j
64 
65  ! Get Q grid size
66  nx = size(q, 1)
67  ny = size(q, 2)
68 
69 
70  ! Pre-compute 1.0/(dx^2) and 1.0/(dy^2)
71  dx2 = 1.0 / (dx * dx)
72  dy2 = 1.0 / (dy * dy)
73 
74  ! Start computing derivatives
75  ! Corner nodes
76  ! Top-left
77  lap_x = (c(2, 1) - 2.0 * c(1, 1) + conc_halo(1,left)) * dx2
78  lap_y = (c(1, 2) - 2.0 * c(1, 1) + conc_halo(1,up)) * dy2
79  q(1, 1) = mu(1, 1) - kappa * (lap_x + lap_y)
80 
81  ! Bottom-left
82  lap_x = (c(2, ny) - 2.0 * c(1, ny) + conc_halo(ny, left)) * dx2
83  lap_y = (conc_halo(1, down) - 2.0 * c(1, ny) + c(1, ny-1)) * dy2
84  q(1, ny) = mu(1, ny) - kappa * (lap_x + lap_y)
85 
86  ! Bottom-right
87  lap_x = (conc_halo(ny,right) - 2.0 * c(nx, ny) + c(nx-1, ny)) * dx2
88  lap_y = (conc_halo(nx,down) - 2.0 * c(nx, ny) + c(nx, ny-1)) * dy2
89  q(nx, ny) = mu(nx, ny) - kappa * (lap_x + lap_y)
90 
91  ! Top-right
92  !print*, conc_halo(nx,up)
93  lap_x = (conc_halo(1, right) - 2.0 * c(nx,1 ) + c(nx-1,1 )) * dx2
94  lap_y = (c(nx, 2) - 2.0 * c(nx, 1) + conc_halo(nx,up)) * dy2
95  q(nx, 1) = mu(nx, 1) - kappa * (lap_x + lap_y)
96 
97  ! Boundary nodes
98  ! Top - j = 1
99  !$omp parallel do default(shared) private(i,lap_x,lap_y)
100  do i = 2, nx - 1
101  lap_y = (c(i, 2) - 2.0 * c(i, 1) + conc_halo(i, up)) * dy2
102  lap_x = (c(i + 1, 1) - 2.0 * c(i, 1) + c(i - 1, 1)) * dx2
103  q(i, 1) = mu(i, 1) - kappa * (lap_x + lap_y)
104  lap_y = (conc_halo(i, down) - 2.0 * c(i, ny) + c(i, ny - 1)) * dy2
105  lap_x = (c(i + 1, ny) - 2.0 * c(i, ny) + c(i - 1, ny)) * dx2
106  q(i, ny) = mu(i, ny) - kappa * (lap_x + lap_y)
107  end do
108  !$omp end parallel do
109  ! LHS - i = 1
110  !$omp parallel do default(shared) private(j,lap_x,lap_y)
111  do j = 2, ny - 1
112  lap_y = (c(1, j + 1) - 2.0 * c(1, j) + c(1, j - 1)) * dy2
113  lap_x = (c(2, j) - 2.0 * c(1, j) + conc_halo(j, left)) * dx2
114  q(1, j) = mu(1,j) - kappa * (lap_x + lap_y)
115  lap_y = (c(nx, j + 1) - 2.0 * c(nx, j) + c(nx, j - 1)) * dy2
116  lap_x = (conc_halo(j,right) - 2.0 * c(nx, j) + c(nx - 1, j)) * dx2
117  q(nx, j) = mu(nx, j) - kappa * (lap_x + lap_y)
118  end do
119  !$omp end parallel do
120  ! Bulk (non-boundary) nodes
121  !$omp parallel do default(shared) private(j,i,lap_x,lap_y)
122  do i = 2, nx - 1
123  do j = 2, ny - 1
124  lap_y = (c(i, j + 1) - 2 * c(i, j) + c(i, j - 1)) * dy2
125  lap_x = (c(i + 1, j) - 2 * c(i, j) + c(i - 1, j)) * dx2
126  q(i, j) = mu(i, j) - kappa * (lap_x + lap_y)
127  end do
128  end do
129  !$omp end parallel do
130 
131  end subroutine total_potential
132 
133 end module potentials

Subroutine to calculate total chemical potential.

grid::left
integer, parameter, public left
